issues.description: The problem statement explicitly requires calculateTotalPrice to be static (lines 77-81), but the reference solution implements calculateTotalPrice as an instance method (SealSaloon.calculateTotalPrice is non-static in solution repository). This mismatch (static vs. instance) can cause confusion for students about the expected method signature and may cause tests or example usages that call SealSaloon.calculateTotalPrice(...) statically to fail against the provided solution.
issues.suggested_fix: Make the calculateTotalPrice method static in the solution (declare it as public static int calculateTotalPrice(Meal meal)) so it matches the explicit requirement in the problem statement. Alternatively, if the intended design is for an instance method, update the problem statement to remove the static requirement and make it clear calculateTotalPrice is an instance method.

issues.description: There is an internal inconsistency within the problem statement regarding whether certain SealSaloon methods/attributes should be static. The UML portion (lines 25-34) shows method signatures without indicating static-ness, while the textual requirements later (lines 77-81) explicitly state that stock, acceptSupplyDelivery and calculateTotalPrice must be static. This contradiction could confuse students about whether to implement these members as static or instance-level.
issues.suggested_fix: Resolve the contradiction in the problem statement: update the UML to explicitly mark which members are static (or add a note in the UML) to match the textual requirement, or remove/update the textual 'must be static' statements to match the UML. Be explicit so students know whether to implement stock and the mentioned methods as static members.
